title: Bar magnet moving through the solenoid

content.description: Students are to perform an experiment using a <math alttext="15 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn><mtext>â€‰cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> long solenoid, a magnetic field probe, a bar magnet, a power supply, connecting wires, and meters for collecting voltage and current data.
content.question:
The students disconnect the solenoid from the power supply and connect the solenoid to the voltmeter. They move the bar magnet into, through, and out of the solenoid at constant speed, as shown. The length of the bar magnet is much smaller than the length of the solenoid. When will the voltmeter detect an <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll"> <mtext>emf</mtext> </math>?

When the bar magnet is entering the solenoid

When the bar magnet is moving through the center of the solenoid

When the bar magnet is leaving the solenoid

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
